intro: Benthamantha caribaea var. dubia, commonly known as the Caribbean benthamantha, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
